titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia Lewis O 100: Majmūʻah-ʼi Bhagat Māl.

This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

msContents.summary: Collection of various prose, poetry, and hymns related to Krishna and Ganesha. A section of the Bhagat Māl (f. 1r-21v), followed by an incomplete prose account of Krishna's visit to the house of a rāja in Persian (f. 24v-51v) and finishing with a set of Hymns to Krishna and Ganesha (54r-127v). The collection is chiefly in Hindustani written in Perso-Arabic script, with about 20 leaves in Persian.

author.name: Free Library of Philadelphia. Rare Book Department. John Frederick Lewis Collection of Oriental Manuscripts

msItem.title: [Incomplete prose account of Krishna's visit to the house of a rāja]

supportDesc.extent: 127 leaves : 153 x 90 (135 x 72) mm bound to 159 x 97 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Hindu-Arabic numeral foliation in ink, center fore-edge margin recto (1-128 with some misnumbering). Component texts are also foliated individually. Continuous modern foliation added in pencil, upper left recto; catchwords every verso, lower left. References in the record are to the modern foliation.

layoutDesc.layout: Several different layouts: f. 1r-7v in 16 long lines; f. 8v-21v in 16-18 lines with 6 lines in three sets of two inset on each page; f. 24v-51v in 13 long lines; f. 54r-67v, 76r-119v, and 124r-127v laid out in landscape, with the text running parallel to the gutter, generally with two lines inset at the head of the page, then 7 lines in two columns; f. 69r-75v, 8 lines in two columns written diagonally; f. 77r-79v written in 12 lines divided into three groups of four lines each; f. 119r-123v, also in landscape, written as blocks of prose, 9 lines to a page.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in nastaʻlīq in black ink; pointed.

decoDesc.decoNote: Rubrications in red. Border-ruled in red for text areas, including between columns. Six full-page illustrations in color (f. 23v, 53v, 60v, 89r, 100r, 114r) and two smaller illustrations set into the text (f. 76r).
Note in English: "Bhagt Mall. Sacred Hymns to Krishna (Hindu language written in Persian) 1796. Bought at Benares India Dec 1905"
Polychrome illustration: central figure with 5 attendants
Polychrome illustration: central figure with two attendants
Polychrome illustration: Narasimha disemboweling the demon king Hiranyakashipu as a devotee looks on
Polychrome illustration: Rama, Sita, and Balarama

binding.p: Bound in green half covers with marbled sides.

origin.p: A portion of the item is dated to 1211 (1832) and copied by Damāl Dās (f. 21v) and another date, 1846, also appears in the text (f. 126v).

history.provenance: Gift of Anne Baker Lewis in 1933.
Purchased in "Benares India, Dec 1905" (note in pencil, flyleaf 1 verso).
Formerly owned by Oliver Henry Perkins (bookplate inside front cover).
Sold in Perkins' sale at Anderson Galleries on March 23 and 24, 1926, lot 579 (catalog cutting pasted across the back inside cover and last flyleaf verso).
Formerly owned by John Frederick Lewis.
